definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The broom blooms when the bluebells bloom.
sentences.chinese: 野风信子开花时金雀花也开花了。

sentences.english: Henry ii was the first king of the house of plantagenet.
sentences.chinese: 亨利二世是金雀花王朝的第一位国王。

sentences.english: And remember—it’s your birthday. You can’t go out there, in all that gorse.
sentences.chinese: 还有，记住今天是你生日，你不能混到金雀花堆里去。
金雀花，俗称农民的诅咒。

sentences.english: But genistein prevented those proteins from being activated, " he said."
sentences.chinese: 但是高金雀花碱阻止了这些蛋白的活化。

sentences.english: Henry π was the first king of the House of Plantagenet.
sentences.chinese: 亨利二世是金雀花王朝的首位国王。

sentences.english: Polo: There are some great kings in the House of Plantagenet .
sentences.chinese: 金雀花王朝出现了几个伟大的国王。

sentences.english: Her horse shied violently at a gorse bush.
sentences.chinese: 金雀花丛把她的马惊得猛然后退。

sentences.english: Australian leafless shrub resembling broom and having small yellow flowers.
sentences.chinese: 一种澳大利亚的无叶灌木，类似金雀花，花。

sentences.english: The first nose is delicate with aromas of cut hay, vanilla, broom and finally hawthorn.
sentences.chinese: 嗅觉上首先感到甘草，香草，金雀花和山楂的芳香。

definition: Eupatorium, e.g. Japanese bog orchid (Eupatorium japonicum Thunb)
